cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 39 (Tuesday, March 5, 2024)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mrs. MILLER of West Virginia:H.R. 7548.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8The single subject of this legislation is:Transportation[Page H823]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Accountability.

bill.title: Small Business Transportation Investment Act of 2024

item.title: Small Business Transportation Investment Act of 2024
Small Business Transportation Investment Act of 2024

To direct the Administrator of General Services to establish a program to sell surplus Government motor vehicles to certain small businesses that provide ground transportation service, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Accountability.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
